Class Shop

  • java.lang.Object
    • Locations
      • Shop

  • public class Shop
extends Locations
    Date: May 17th 2018 This class creates Location, Shop. The Shop class's parent class is Locations. This class creates a Shop for each City. Renews stock of each item when a city is created. Allows the User to buy Items from the Shop in exchange for Gold.
    Author:
    Sachin Sakthivel and Sasiru Goonatillake

      java.lang.String buy​(Team team, int input)
      This method lets the User to buy Items from the Shop.
      int[] getShopList​()
      This method returns the Integer ArrayList 'ShopList' which contain Stocks of each item in the Shop.
      void setShopList​(int[] StockList)
      This method updates the stocks by using Integer ArrayList variable input 'StockList', so that the 'ShopList' is updated.
      void travel​(GameEnvironment game)
      This method is the parent method travel() for subclasses to travel to and from other locations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shop

        public Shop​()
        Constructor method for Shop. Sets the locations Name to "Wanderer's Shop" using parent class, Locations. Randomizes the stock of each item and equates the stock list to Integer ArrayList variable 'ShopList'.

    • Method Detail

      • travel

        public void travel​(GameEnvironment game)
        Description copied from class: Locations
        This method is the parent method travel() for subclasses to travel to and from other locations.
        Overrides:
        travel in class Locations
        Parameters:
        game - Input variable 'game' of type GameEnvironment.

      • buy

        public java.lang.String buy​(Team team,
                            int input)
        This method lets the User to buy Items from the Shop. An item is bought if enough gold is present and the Item is taken off from the Stock and added to the Team Inventory. Returns a String output which notifies the User of the result of the action.
        Parameters:
        team - The current team status is inputed to get attributes such as Inventory and Gold.
        input - Input variable which determines which Item is being purchased.
        Returns:
        Returns a String variable 'out' which notifies the User of the result.

      • getShopList

        public int[] getShopList​()
        This method returns the Integer ArrayList 'ShopList' which contain Stocks of each item in the Shop.
        Returns:
        Returns the Integer ArrayList 'ShopList'.

      • setShopList

        public void setShopList​(int[] StockList)
        This method updates the stocks by using Integer ArrayList variable input 'StockList', so that the 'ShopList' is updated.
        Parameters:
        StockList - Integer ArrayList variable input 'StockList' containing updated Stock information.
